title: Authorizes certain fire districts to offer certain benefits to their volunteer firefighters subject to mandatory referendum
summary: Authorizes certain fire districts to offer certain benefits to their volunteer firefighters subject to mandatory referendum.

S T A T E   O F   N E W   Y O R K
       ________________________________________________________________________

                                          756

                              2011-2012 Regular Sessions

                                 I N  A S S E M B L Y

                                      (PREFILED)

                                    January 5, 2011
                                      ___________

       Introduced  by M. of A. RABBITT -- read once and referred to the Commit-
         tee on Local Governments

       AN ACT to amend the town law and the general municipal law, in  relation
         to  authorizing  certain  fire  districts to offer certain benefits to
         their volunteer firefighters subject to a mandatory referendum

         THE PEOPLE OF THE STATE OF NEW YORK, REPRESENTED IN SENATE AND  ASSEM-
       BLY, DO ENACT AS FOLLOWS:

    1    Section 1. Subdivision 18 of section 176 of the town law is amended by
    2  adding a new paragraph 7-b to read as follows:
    3    (7-B)   THE  PAYMENTS  FOR  PARTICIPATION  IN  DEPARTMENT  DRILLS  AND
    4  RESPONSES MADE TO VOLUNTEER FIREFIGHTERS AND VOLUNTEER OFFICERS  OF  THE
    5  FIRE DEPARTMENT PURSUANT TO SECTION TWO HUNDRED EIGHTEEN-A OF THE GENER-
    6  AL MUNICIPAL LAW,
    7    S  2.  The  general  municipal  law is amended by adding a new section
    8  218-a to read as follows:
    9    S  218-A.  PAYMENTS  FOR  PARTICIPATION  IN  DEPARTMENT   DRILLS   AND
   10  RESPONSES. 1. UPON THE AFFIRMATIVE VOTE OF AT LEAST SIXTY PERCENT OF THE
   11  GOVERNING BOARD OF A FIRE DISTRICT WHICH HAS ESTABLISHED A SERVICE AWARD
   12  PROGRAM PURSUANT TO THIS ARTICLE, THERE SHALL BE HELD A MANDATORY REFER-
   13  ENDUM  OF  THE  ELIGIBLE  VOTERS  WITHIN SUCH FIRE DISTRICT TO DETERMINE
   14  WHETHER SUCH GOVERNING BOARD SHALL AUTHORIZE PAYMENTS FOR  PARTICIPATION
   15  IN  DEPARTMENT  DRILLS  AND RESPONSES PURSUANT TO THE PROVISIONS OF THIS
   16  SECTION.
   17    2. THE REFERENDUM DESCRIBED IN SUBDIVISION ONE OF THIS  SECTION  SHALL
   18  STATE  THE MAXIMUM ANNUAL COST OF THE PAYMENTS AUTHORIZED, INCLUDING THE
   19  ESTIMATED ANNUAL ADMINISTRATION COSTS AND THE MAXIMUM ANNUAL PAYMENT  TO
   20  A PARTICIPATING ACTIVE VOLUNTEER FIREFIGHTER, PURSUANT TO THIS SECTION.
   21    3.  THE MAXIMUM ANNUAL COST TO A FIRE DISTRICT OF THE PAYMENTS AUTHOR-
   22  IZED SHALL BE TWO HUNDRED FIFTY THOUSAND DOLLARS AND THE MAXIMUM  ANNUAL

        EXPLANATION--Matter in ITALICS (underscored) is new; matter in brackets
                             [ ] is old law to be omitted.
                                                                  LBD03901-01-1

       A. 756                              2

    1  PAYMENT  TO OR ON BEHALF OF A PARTICIPATING ACTIVE VOLUNTEER FIREFIGHTER
    2  SHALL BE SIX THOUSAND DOLLARS.
    3    4.  ONCE  SUCH PAYMENTS HAVE BEEN AUTHORIZED, THE AUTHORIZATION MAY BE
    4  ABOLISHED OR AMENDED IN THE SAME MANNER AS IT WAS APPROVED BY THE PROCE-
    5  DURES SET FORTH IN SUBDIVISION ONE OF THIS SECTION, BUT NO SUCH ABOLISH-
    6  MENT OR AMENDMENT MAY BE EFFECTIVE PRIOR TO THE FIRST DAY OF THE  CALEN-
    7  DAR YEAR FOLLOWING SUCH AUTHORIZATION.
    8    5. NOTWITHSTANDING ANY INCONSISTENT PROVISION OF LAW, NO MEMBER OF THE
    9  GOVERNING BOARD OF THE FIRE DISTRICT IS PROHIBITED, BY VIRTUE OF BEING A
   10  MEMBER  OF  A  VOLUNTEER  FIRE COMPANY OR DEPARTMENT, FROM VOTING UPON A
   11  RESOLUTION AUTHORIZING A REFERENDUM ON THE ESTABLISHMENT  OF  A  SERVICE
   12  AWARD  PROGRAM  IF  MORE THAN FORTY PERCENT OF THE GOVERNING BOARD WOULD
   13  OTHERWISE BE PROHIBITED FROM VOTING UPON SUCH RESOLUTION. ANY MEMBER  OF
   14  SUCH  GOVERNING BOARD VOTING UPON SUCH RESOLUTION WHO SERVES AS A MEMBER
   15  OF A VOLUNTEER FIRE COMPANY OR DEPARTMENT  SHALL  PUBLICLY  DISCLOSE  IN
   16  WRITING  TO  THE  GOVERNING  BOARD  SUCH STATUS. SUCH WRITTEN DISCLOSURE
   17  SHALL BE PART OF AND SET FORTH IN THE OFFICIAL RECORD OF THE PROCEEDINGS
   18  OF SUCH GOVERNING BOARD.
   19    6. RECEIPT OF SUCH PAYMENTS SHALL NOT ALTER THE STATUS OF A PERSON  AS
   20  AN  ACTIVE  VOLUNTEER  FIREFIGHTER UNDER THIS ARTICLE, OR AS A VOLUNTEER
   21  FIREMAN PURSUANT TO SECTION THREE OF THE VOLUNTEER FIREFIGHTER'S BENEFIT
   22  LAW, OR AS A VOLUNTEER FIREFIGHTER UNDER SECTION TWO HUNDRED  FIVE-B  OF
   23  THIS  CHAPTER,  OR  AS A VOLUNTEER FIREFIGHTER OR VOLUNTEER FIRE OFFICER
   24  UNDER ANY OTHER LAW OR REGULATION AND SUCH PERSONS SHALL NOT  BE  DEEMED
   25  PAID FIREFIGHTERS BY VIRTUE OF RECEIPT OF SUCH PAYMENTS.
   26    7.  EACH  ACTIVE  VOLUNTEER FIREFIGHTER WHO IS A MEMBER OF A VOLUNTEER
   27  FIRE COMPANY OR DEPARTMENT WITHIN A FIRE DISTRICT  THAT  HAS  AUTHORIZED
   28  PAYMENTS PURSUANT TO THIS SECTION, MAY ELECT TO RECEIVE SUCH PAYMENTS IN
   29  LIEU OF BEING GRANTED CREDITS FOR DRILLS AND PARTICIPATION IN DEPARTMENT
   30  RESPONSES  AS WOULD OTHERWISE BE GRANTED PURSUANT TO SECTION TWO HUNDRED
   31  SEVENTEEN OF THIS ARTICLE. A PARTICIPATING ACTIVE VOLUNTEER  FIREFIGHTER
   32  SHALL BE PAID, SUBJECT TO ANY APPLICABLE WITHHOLDING TAXES, FIVE DOLLARS
   33  FOR  PARTICIPATING  IN EACH QUALIFIED DRILL APPROVED BY THE CHIEF OF THE
   34  DISTRICT OR HIS OR HER DESIGNEE AND FIVE DOLLARS  FOR  PARTICIPATING  IN
   35  ANY  QUALIFIED EMERGENCY RESPONSE. A QUALIFIED DRILL MEANS ANY DRILL FOR
   36  WHICH POINTS COULD BE GRANTED PURSUANT TO SUBDIVISION (C) OF SECTION TWO
   37  HUNDRED SEVENTEEN OF THIS ARTICLE. A QUALIFIED EMERGENCY RESPONSE  MEANS
   38  ANY  DEPARTMENT  RESPONSE  FOR WHICH POINTS COULD BE GRANTED PURSUANT TO
   39  SUBDIVISION (C) OF SECTION TWO HUNDRED SEVENTEEN OF THIS ARTICLE.
   40    8. AN ELECTION BY AN ACTIVE VOLUNTEER FIREFIGHTER TO RECEIVE  PAYMENTS
   41  PURSUANT TO THIS SECTION, SHALL BE MADE IN WRITING ON A FORM APPROVED BY
   42  THE  BOARD OF THE FIRE DISTRICT AND SIGNED BY THE ACTIVE VOLUNTEER FIRE-
   43  FIGHTER NOT MORE THAN SIXTY DAYS IMMEDIATELY PRECEDING THE  COMMENCEMENT
   44  OF  THE  CALENDAR  YEAR,  AND  NOT  DURING  SUCH CALENDAR YEAR FOR WHICH
   45  PAYMENTS UNDER THIS SECTION SHALL BE ELECTED IN LIEU OF CREDITS UNDER  A
   46  SERVICE  AWARD  PROGRAM.  A  TIMELY ELECTION SHALL BE MADE BY THE ACTIVE
   47  VOLUNTEER  FIREFIGHTER  FOR  EACH  SUBSEQUENT  CALENDAR  YEAR.  SUCH  AN
   48  ELECTION  SHALL  NOT  BE  REVOCABLE  BY THE ACTIVE VOLUNTEER FIREFIGHTER
   49  DURING AND WITH RESPECT TO THE CALENDAR YEAR FOR WHICH  HE  OR  SHE  HAS
   50  ELECTED TO BE ELIGIBLE FOR PAYMENTS UNDER THIS SECTION.
   51    9. A RECIPIENT OF ANY PAYMENTS, PURSUANT TO THIS SECTION, FOR A CALEN-
   52  DAR YEAR SHALL NOT BE ELIGIBLE FOR ANY CREDITS FOR DRILLS OR FOR PARTIC-
   53  IPATION IN DEPARTMENT RESPONSES FOR THAT CALENDAR YEAR.
   54    10. THIS SECTION SHALL BE APPLICABLE ONLY TO FIRE DISTRICTS WITHIN THE
   55  TOWN OF WALKILL IN ORANGE COUNTY.

       A. 756                              3

    1    S  3.  A  fire  district  which has determined to provide payments for
    2  participation in department drills and  responses  pursuant  to  section
    3  218-a of the general municipal law, as added by section two of this act,
    4  shall  cause an independent review of such payment program to be made on
    5  or before March 1, 2014. Such report shall be furnished to the governor,
    6  temporary  president  of the senate, the speaker of the assembly and the
    7  office of fire prevention and control in the department of state.
    8    S 4. This act shall take effect immediately provided,  however,  that,
    9  no payments authorized under section 218-a of the general municipal law,
   10  as added by section two of this act, shall accrue on or after January 1,
   11  2015.
